title: Trivia Taster
description: Explore iconic moments, landmarks, and heroes in U.S. history.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.funfact: George Washington was unanimously elected as the first President of the United States.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.funfact: Paris is known as the City of Light.

questions.question: Which year did the United States declare independence?
questions.funfact: The Declaration of Independence was adopted on July 4, 1776.

questions.question: Who wrote the Gettysburg Address?
questions.funfact: Abraham Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address in 1863.

questions.question: Which landmark is known as the symbol of freedom in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France in 1886.

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Father of the Constitution'?
questions.funfact: James Madison played a key role in drafting the U.S. Constitution.

questions.question: Which U.S. state was the last to join the union?
questions.funfact: Hawaii became the 50th state in 1959.

questions.question: What is the largest state in the U.S. by area?
questions.funfact: Alaska is more than twice the size of Texas.

questions.question: Who was the main author of the Declaration of Independence?
questions.funfact: Thomas Jefferson drafted the Declaration of Independence in 1776.

questions.question: Which city hosted the first modern Olympic Games?
questions.funfact: The first modern Olympics were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896.

title: American Adventure
description: Explore iconic moments, landmarks, and heroes in U.S. history.

questions.question: What is the tallest mountain in the United States?
questions.funfact: Denali, formerly known as Mount McKinley, is 20,310 feet tall.

questions.question: Which river is the longest in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: The Missouri River is about 2,341 miles long.

questions.question: Who was the 16th President of the United States?
questions.funfact: Abraham Lincoln led the country during the Civil War.

questions.question: Which U.S. state is known as the 'Sunshine State'?
questions.funfact: Florida is famous for its warm climate and beaches.

questions.question: What is the national bird of the United States?
questions.funfact: The Bald Eagle was chosen as the national bird in 1782.

questions.question: Which U.S. city is known as the 'Big Apple'?
questions.funfact: New York City is often called the 'Big Apple.'

questions.question: Who invented the light bulb?
questions.funfact: Thomas Edison patented the first practical light bulb in 1879.

questions.question: Which U.S. state is famous for Hollywood?
questions.funfact: Hollywood is a neighborhood in Los Angeles, California.

questions.question: What is the largest lake in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: Lake Superior is the largest of the Great Lakes.

questions.question: Who was the first man to walk on the moon?
questions.funfact: Neil Armstrong set foot on the moon in 1969.

title: Sports & Superstars
description: Dive into the world of sports with player stats and epic moments

questions.question: Which country won the FIFA World Cup in 2018?
questions.funfact: France won the FIFA World Cup in 2018, defeating Croatia 4-2 in the final.

questions.question: Who holds the record for most Olympic gold medals?
questions.funfact: Michael Phelps has won 23 Olympic gold medals.

questions.question: Which sport uses a puck?
questions.funfact: Ice hockey is played with a rubber puck.

questions.question: Who is known as 'The King of Basketball'?
questions.funfact: LeBron James is often called 'King James.'

questions.question: Which country hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics?
questions.funfact: The 2016 Summer Olympics were held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

questions.question: What is the national sport of Japan?
questions.funfact: Sumo wrestling is considered Japan's national sport.

questions.question: Who won the NBA MVP award in 2021?
questions.funfact: Nikola Jokic became the first Denver Nuggets player to win MVP.

questions.question: Which tennis player has won the most Grand Slam titles?
questions.funfact: Serena Williams has 23 Grand Slam singles titles.

questions.question: What is the maximum score in a single frame of bowling?
questions.funfact: A strike followed by two more strikes scores 30 in a frame.

questions.question: Which country is famous for the sport of cricket?
questions.funfact: Cricket is the most popular sport in India.

title: Brainy Basics
description: Fun facts about the natural world, animals, and scientific wonders.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
questions.funfact: H2O stands for two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.funfact: Mars appears red due to iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal on Earth?
questions.funfact: The blue whale can weigh up to 200 tons.

questions.question: Which gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere?
questions.funfact: Plants use carbon dioxide for photosynthesis.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance?
questions.funfact: Diamond is the hardest known natural material.

questions.question: Which animal is known as the King of the Jungle?
questions.funfact: Lions are often called the King of the Jungle.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?
questions.funfact: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at sea level.

questions.question: Which organ pumps blood throughout the body?
questions.funfact: The heart beats about 100,000 times a day.

questions.question: What is the process by which plants make food?
questions.funfact: Photosynthesis uses sunlight to make food from carbon dioxide and water.

questions.question: Which bird is known for its colorful tail?
questions.funfact: Peacocks are famous for their iridescent tail feathers.

title: 5th Grader Genius
description: Can you outsmart a 5th grader? Questions upto 5th Grade.

questions.question: How many continents are there on Earth?
questions.funfact: There are seven continents: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia.

questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.funfact: Jupiter is so big that over 1,300 Earths could fit inside it.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Charlotte's Web'?
questions.funfact: E.B. White wrote 'Charlotte's Web' in 1952.

questions.question: What is the freezing point of water?
questions.funfact: Water freezes at 0°C (32°F).

questions.question: Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?
questions.funfact: Japan is called the Land of the Rising Sun.

questions.question: What is the main language spoken in Brazil?
questions.funfact: Portuguese is the official language of Brazil.

questions.question: Which shape has three sides?
questions.funfact: A triangle has three sides and three angles.

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.funfact: The skin is the body's largest organ.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.funfact: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa in the early 1500s.

questions.question: What is the smallest prime number?
questions.funfact: 2 is the only even prime number.

title: The Great Outdoors
description: Facts about U.S. national parks, wildlife, and outdoor adventures.

questions.question: Which is the largest national park in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park in Alaska is the largest in the U.S.

questions.question: What is the state flower of Texas?
questions.funfact: The bluebonnet is the state flower of Texas.

questions.question: Which animal is known for building dams?
questions.funfact: Beavers build dams to create ponds for their homes.

questions.question: What is the tallest tree species in the world?
questions.funfact: Coast redwoods can grow over 350 feet tall.

questions.question: Which U.S. state is home to the Grand Canyon?
questions.funfact: The Grand Canyon is located in northern Arizona.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: The Great Basin Desert covers much of Nevada and Utah.

questions.question: Which bird is the fastest in the world?
questions.funfact: The peregrine falcon can dive at speeds over 200 mph.

questions.question: What is the deepest lake in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: Crater Lake in Oregon is 1,943 feet deep.

questions.question: Which U.S. state has the most national parks?
questions.funfact: California has nine national parks, more than any other state.

questions.question: What is the most visited national park in the U.S.?
questions.funfact: The Great Smoky Mountains National Park attracts over 12 million visitors a year.

title: Riddle Me This
description: A mix of riddles, puzzles, and brain teasers for the whole family.

questions.question: What has keys but can't open locks?
questions.funfact: A piano has 88 keys but none can open a lock!

questions.question: What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
questions.funfact: A clock's 'face' shows the time, and its 'hands' point to the hours and minutes.

questions.question: What gets wetter as it dries?
questions.funfact: A towel dries you off but gets wetter itself!

questions.question: What has a neck but no head?
questions.funfact: A bottle has a neck but no head.

questions.question: What has an eye but cannot see?
questions.funfact: The 'eye' of a needle is the hole for the thread.

questions.question: What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
questions.funfact: A glove fits your hand but isn't alive.

questions.question: What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
questions.funfact: A stamp stays in the corner of an envelope but can travel the world.

questions.question: What has a head and a tail but no body?
questions.funfact: A coin has a head and a tail side.

questions.question: What comes down but never goes up?
questions.funfact: Rain always falls down from the sky.

questions.question: What has one eye but can't see?
questions.funfact: The 'eye' of a needle is for threading.

title: Pop Culture Power-Up
description: Test your knowledge of movies, music, TV shows, and video games.

questions.question: Who played Harry Potter in the movies?
questions.funfact: Daniel Radcliffe starred as Harry Potter in all eight films.

questions.question: Which band sang 'Hey Jude'?
questions.funfact: 'Hey Jude' was released by The Beatles in 1968.

questions.question: What is the name of the princess in 'Frozen'?
questions.funfact: Elsa is the Snow Queen in Disney's 'Frozen.'

questions.question: Who created the video game 'Super Mario'?
questions.funfact: Shigeru Miyamoto designed 'Super Mario Bros.' in 1985.

questions.question: Which movie features the song 'Circle of Life'?
questions.funfact: 'Circle of Life' is a famous song from 'The Lion King.'

questions.question: Who is the main character in the video game 'The Legend of Zelda'?
questions.funfact: Link is the hero in 'The Legend of Zelda' series.

questions.question: Which TV show features a coffee shop called Central Perk?
questions.funfact: Central Perk is the iconic coffee shop in 'Friends.'

questions.question: Who voiced Woody in 'Toy Story'?
questions.funfact: Tom Hanks voiced Woody in all 'Toy Story' movies.

questions.question: Which movie won the Oscar for Best Picture in 2020?
questions.funfact: 'Parasite' was the first non-English film to win Best Picture.

questions.question: Who is the creator of 'Star Wars'?
questions.funfact: George Lucas created the 'Star Wars' universe.

title: Legends & Stories
description: Myths, legends, and famous stories from around the world.

questions.question: Who pulled the sword from the stone in Arthurian legend?
questions.funfact: King Arthur is said to have pulled Excalibur from the stone.

questions.question: Who is the Greek god of the sea?
questions.funfact: Poseidon is one of the twelve Olympian deities.

questions.question: What is the name of the Norse god of thunder?
questions.funfact: Thor wields a magical hammer called Mjölnir.

questions.question: Who is the main character in 'The Odyssey'?
questions.funfact: Odysseus is the hero of Homer's epic poem 'The Odyssey.'

questions.question: Which legendary bird rises from its ashes?
questions.funfact: The phoenix symbolizes rebirth and immortality.

questions.question: Who is the trickster god in Norse mythology?
questions.funfact: Loki is known for his cunning and mischief.

questions.question: What is the name of the dragon in 'The Hobbit'?
questions.funfact: Smaug is the main antagonist in 'The Hobbit.'

questions.question: Who is the hero of the Greek myth 'The Twelve Labors'?
questions.funfact: Hercules completed twelve nearly impossible tasks.

questions.question: Which story features a wooden puppet who wants to be a real boy?
questions.funfact: Pinocchio's nose grows when he tells a lie.

questions.question: Who is the main villain in 'Peter Pan'?
questions.funfact: Captain Hook is Peter Pan's arch-nemesis.

title: Kids Curosity Corner
description: A playful pack designed for youngs with fun, educational questions.

questions.question: Which fruit is used to make wine?
questions.funfact: Grapes are the primary fruit used to make wine, particularly red and white wines.

questions.question: Sushi is a cuisine from which country?
questions.funfact: Sushi is a traditional Japanese dish, consisting of vinegared rice and various ingredients.

questions.question: What color are school buses in the United States?
questions.funfact: School buses are yellow for high visibility.

questions.question: Which animal says 'moo'?
questions.funfact: Cows are known for their 'moo' sound.

questions.question: What do bees make?
questions.funfact: Bees make honey from flower nectar.

questions.question: Which shape has four equal sides?
questions.funfact: A square has four equal sides and four right angles.

questions.question: What is the color of the sky on a clear day?
questions.funfact: The sky appears blue due to the scattering of sunlight.

questions.question: Which animal is known as man's best friend?
questions.funfact: Dogs are often called man's best friend.

questions.question: What do you use to write on a blackboard?
questions.funfact: Chalk is used to write on blackboards.

questions.question: Which planet do we live on?
questions.funfact: Earth is the third planet from the Sun.
